text:
The filter org.apache.tools.ant.filters.LineContains produces a stack overflow 
when used in large files.
This is due to a recursion in the read() method that can be avoided (there is 
one recursion for each line of the file, hence the problem for large files).
I've already submitted a fix for this in Ant 1.5 beta.
It was approved and integrated by 'umagesh' (version 1.4.2.1 of the file 
LineContains.java), but removed some weeks later by 'bodewig' (version 1.4.2.2 
of the same file).
Therefore, the version 1.5.1 of Ant breaks when this filter is used on large 
files.

Regards,
Frederic
creator: fpesquet@yahoo.fr

text:
OK, I see the recursion problem in all filters, so they all need to get addressed.

The reason that I reverted your original patch was that it caused the filter to
skip valid lines, see Bug 9762 and Bug 13048.

I will try to use your original patch as a basis for a new one that doesn't skip
matches (fortunately we have tests now).
creator: bodewig@apache.org
bodewig@apache.org

<linecontains> is supposed to be fixed in nightly build 2003-02-18 and later.

Leaving it open to remind me that the other filters need to be audited as well.

<linecontainsregexp> and <striplinecomments> had the same problem.  Fixed in 
nightly build 2003-02-19.
